Fatal error: Uncaught Blockchain\Exception\ApiError: Unknown API key

issues.title: Create account in blockchain wallet
issues.body:
Using api-v1-client I have created multiple wallet like wallet1,wallet2..etc. Now I want to send bitcoin from my wallet1 to wallet2 and consider my wallet1 having 10 bitocin balance. But when i try to send bitcoin from wallet1 to wallet2 at that time it'll give me error like : 

Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'Blockchain\Exception\ApiError' with message 'Error building transaction' in 

Also open the ticket on support of blockchain.info and their reply is : 

You may have many small amounts of bitcoin in many addresses in the wallet (which you would need to try and consolidate to send normally).

Can you try making a new account in your wallet, and then transferring all funds in your wallet to this new account. Then, in your api call, add an &from=1 (to denote the second account in your wallet that you just created). Or, if this is the third account in the wallet, it would be &from=2

So Now my question is that how to create account in my wallet using api..?

issues.title: Error decrypting wallet, please check that your password is correct
issues.body:
Here is all my current versions are : 
           node v6.9.4
           npm  v3.10.10
           blockchain-wallet-service v0.23.3

If I am trying to send bitcoin from my account at that time it'll send error like 
Error : 
  error: Error decrypting wallet, please check that your password is correct

please help on same ASAP

issues.title: Error building transaction
issues.body:
When I try to send bitcoin from one wallet to another wallet which is generated via api at that time it will give me error like bellow : 

Uncaught exception 'Blockchain\Exception\ApiError' with message 'Error building transaction' in D:\wamp\www\apiv1\src\Blockchain.php on line 114
( ! ) Blockchain\Exception\ApiError: Error building transaction in D:\wamp\www\apiv1\src\Blockchain.php on line 114

Please revert me ASAP. and dive me the case or scenario when it'll occur also describe the error what exactly it says.

issues.title: Documentation
issues.body: On your doc you should set the resource as $Blockchain->setServiceUrl('http://localhost:3000/'); we worked 30 min to find out that it's not calling to the right url.

Merge pull request #56 from sp111/#32-issue-unable-to-decode-json-response

Changed API resource to api/v2/create

Unable to decode JSON Response #32

Merge pull request #54 from assafY/upgrade-client

Upgrade client
fixed some new non working functions
fixed multi address and get xpub bug
removed note and confirmations params from wallet
added optional v2 generate param and added check gap function
added get chart and get pools objects and functions
updated docs, finished with block explorer upgrade
added xpub and multiaddr methods and objects
add limit and confirmations to unspent outputs method

Merge pull request #42 from Montymort/patch-1

Missing slash in service url

Update Blockchain.php

Fix for getting a "not found" error when using the library. The cause is a missing slash in the called url after the port.

Removed references to RP1

Merge pull request #38 from pdpi/master

Merge pull request #36 from alecalve/service-mywallet-v3

Upgrade to service-my-wallet-v3
Added confirmations parameter to calls that will use it
Changed URL for calls to service-mywallet
Changed link parameter name to label in createwallet

Support V2 of Receive API

Update README.md

Update README.md

Renamed PushTX.php to Push.php to fix class not found error
Renamed PushTX.php to Push.php to fix class not found error

Updating old documentation and misspelling.

Merge pull request #10 from c88lopez/master

Adding composer install availability feature
Updating the examples to load the composer autoload instead the god class

Adding those isolated functions into a conversion class and refactor where their are used.
Updating .gitignore and composer.json.
Renaming the deprecated class name on the instantiation and applying the 'use' statement
Removing old class name on instantiation for the new ones and using 'use'
Creating a file per existent class and a folder per first class of every file

Deleting 'Exception.php' which contains a lot of classes to defining them in isolated files.
Deleting 'require_once' of 'Exception.php'
Renaming folder name for the standard 'src'

Adding composer support.

fix for "Failed opening required '__DIR__/..."
Update UnspentOutput to have big-endian transaction hash, adding th_hash_le for the little-endian version.
BTC values as strings. Wallet preliminaries.
Add classes for Bitcoin types, update logging

issue_comments.body: Your transaction size may have been too small. Please see https://github.com/blockchain/My-Wallet/issues/111
Docs have been updated to reflect minimum transaction size of 0.005 BTC for public notes.

Okay, I went ahead and unbanned this IP address. To prevent getting banned again, you may want to apply for a free API key here: https://blockchain.info/api/api_create_code -- this will let you get past the request limiters.
Well this will be 3rd time that I will try to get the API key. And I just want to get this simple example working -> https://blockchain.info/pl/api/api_receive
You shouldn't need an api key to use the receive payments API. Are you making a high number of requests in a short amount of time?

I'v got It done and it's working - TY for unban. I don't think that My web page is sending large number of requests. Request is made when someone clicks on Donate Button and how many PPL out there are clicking Donate buttons? It would be nice from Your side if You check scripts for giving API keys to users because I wish to implement Wallet on my web page as well and still don't have any info in my email box and I have applied 3 times now.
Yes I have API Key. Thank You Very Much for Your Help. Have a nice New Year Party and even better whole new Year.
You too. Sorry for all the trouble.

Please describe how this relates to the PHP client library. 

Some screenshots might help, as well.
`__DIR__` was implemented in PHP 5.3.0, but this patch allows backwards compatibility beyond that.

Making this api available through composer is something we would be interested in, so it will be done eventually. 

EDIT: 'eventually' is sooner than expected, this lib will be available through composer very soon.
This is an issue for the php demo, not the php api library. Please open an issue there.
is there any ETA for this?

Hi,

Can you test and see if the project works with composer? We pushed support to the dev branch

https://github.com/blockchain/api-v1-client-php/tree/dev

Sorry if I misunderstood but you want me to make this possible?

If so I'll fork it and start working.

EDIT: I saw that you have merged a composer.json but it is not enough. You have to implement namespaces all over file with classes.

Here is a good link: http://jessesnet.com/development-notes/2014/php-composer-autoloading/

Hm, alright. So does this mean each php file needs its own folder? And is the directory 'src' required, or can we specify our current 'lib' directory?

In order to get this right, would you be willing to fork this lib and create a pull request with the necessary changes?

All php file which contains a class needs a namespace. These files only contains the class.
I think we can specify the 'lib' directory as the source, it is a configuration on the composer.json file.

I could make the changes, you will get a merge request soon.
Awesome, thanks! When you make the pull request I'll look it over, merge, and update with packagist
Epic! Thank you c88lopez!
Thanks so much!
Did you install the library with Composer?
@clarkmoody Done. haven't tested the code after changing to json_encode though, there shouldn't be any errors.

Hi,

Is this is issue with the PHP client library, or the receive payments API?

Problem with API (library works correctly, thanks!).
But I don't know any developers contacts, therefore write here.
Problem in the api/receive method.
I send api_key, method (create) and address (destination).
It returns json object
{
    "input_address": "12QjLh3XXFyCs2X9UTNVqAyeBwVq69Rd4d",
    "destination": "19YVpCqUR3JkiNBqozGxoBFej28utodMrb",
    "fee_percent": 0
}
But if I login in the web wallet https://blockchain.info/wallet/ no new addresses in the "Receive money" tab.
Help me, please.
The receive API endpoint does not add addresses to your wallet. Rather, it forwards all funds send to the `input_address` to the `destination` address you specified.

I understood, but. If you read my first message no money redirect here :(
You can check it by transaction: https://blockchain.info/tx/f07708e3dfe5dd00ba62b1ac124419174af6365a74578b0e34fb6d4528f21b58
I send some money to new generated "input address" and money still on "input address".
Destination address is empty (no money): https://blockchain.info/address/19YVpCqUR3JkiNBqozGxoBFej28utodMrb
And I have no access to that "input" address to operate with that money. Thay are in /dev/null apparently..
I believe this is an issue with the API itself, not the PHP client library. I have forwarded this issue to the dev team.
Thank you very much!

Hey, 

This issue should be solved now. Sorry for the inconvenience!

-Kevin

<?php
/\* vim: set expandtab tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4: */

/**
- Short File Description
  *
- PHP version 5
  *
- @category   aCategory
- @package    aPackage
- @subpackage aSubPackage
- @author     anAuthor
- @copyright  2014 a Copyright
- @license    a License
- @link       http://www.aLink.com
  */

namespace Blockchain;

use \Blockchain\Exception\Error;
use \Blockchain\Exception\ApiError;
use \Blockchain\Exception\HttpError;

use \Blockchain\Create\Create;
use \Blockchain\Explorer\Explorer;
use \Blockchain\PushTX\Push;
use \Blockchain\Rates\Rates;
use \Blockchain\Receive\Receive;
use \Blockchain\Stats\Stats;
use \Blockchain\Wallet\Wallet;

// Check if BCMath module installed
if(!function_exists('bcscale')) {
    throw new Error("BC Math module not installed.");
}

// Check if curl module installed
if(!function_exists('curl_init')) {
    throw new Error("cURL module not installed.");
}

class Blockchain {
    const URL = 'https://blockchainbdgpzk.onion/';

```
private $ch;
private $api_code = null;

const DEBUG = true;
public $log = Array();

public function __construct($api_code=null) {
    if(!is_null($api_code)) {
        $this->api_code = $api_code;
    }

    $this->ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'Blockchain-PHP/1.0');
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 60);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_CAINFO, dirname(__FILE__).'/Blockchain/ca-bundle.crt');

    //Tor
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, 'localhost:9050');
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_PROXYTYPE, 7);

    $this->Create   = new Create($this);
    $this->Explorer = new Explorer($this);
    $this->Push     = new Push($this);
    $this->Rates    = new Rates($this);
    $this->Receive  = new Receive($this);
    $this->Stats    = new Stats($this);
    $this->Wallet   = new Wallet($this);
}

public function __destruct() {
    curl_close($this->ch);
}

public function setTimeout($timeout) {
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, intval($timeout));
}

public function post($resource, $data=null) {
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_URL, self::URL.$resource);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);

    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, 
        array("Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded"));

    if(!is_null($this->api_code)) {
        $data['api_code'] = $this->api_code;
    }

    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));

    $json = $this->_call();

    // throw ApiError if we get an 'error' field in the JSON
    if(array_key_exists('error', $json)) {
        throw new ApiError($json['error']);
    }

    return $json;
}

public function get($resource, $params=null) {
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POST, false);

    if(!is_null($this->api_code)) {
        $params['api_code'] = $this->api_code;
    }
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, array());

    $query = http_build_query($params);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_URL, self::URL.$resource.'?'.$query);

    return $this->_call();
}

private function _call() {      
    $t0 = microtime(true);
    $response = curl_exec($this->ch);
    $dt = microtime(true) - $t0;

    if(curl_error($this->ch)) {
        $info = curl_getinfo($this->ch);
        throw new HttpError("Call to " . $info['url'] . " failed: " . curl_error($this->ch));
    }
    $json = json_decode($response, true);
    if(is_null($json)) {
        throw new Error("Able to decode JSON response from Blockchain: " . $response);
    }

    if(self::DEBUG) {
        $info = curl_getinfo($this->ch);
        $this->log[] = array(
            'curl_info' => $info,
            'elapsed_ms' => round(1000*$dt)
        );
    }

    return $json;
}
```

}

I found my problem, maybe you have the same.
In my case i was using my Blockchain address that they give when we login, but that is not the key.
The key is the Identifier the one you use to login.

Good luck!

First, make a wallet on Blockchain, then you will get an email telling that this is your Login Link: https://blockchain.info/wallet/indentifier_goes_here
Now you have the identifier and the password is the one you wrote when you created the account.

Now that the API knows you by the identifier and the password you can make requests.

If you use api-v1-client-php library then you don't need to know the url structure, just the functions that are there to make it all easy.
But for the url structures, take a look here: https://blockchain.info/api
API key is not mandatory, you can request a api key only when you start to have more requests then normal. If you insist on getting a API Key and still no answer in 48 hours then use https://blockchain.zendesk.com/home i'm sure the support team will help you.

What address causes these errors?

19ZZ8DZsb5qgchuKPZWET7Uj8rDoj4KgmB
17RTTUAiiPqUTKtEggJPec8RxLMi2n9EZ9

Such addresses shows "Fatal Error: Allowed Memory Size of xx Bytes Exhausted"

To resolve this, I added two lines:

```
set_time_limit(0);
ini_set('memory_limit', '-1');
```

Regarding pagination, I have already set $limit to 50
Maybe lowering `$limit` to something like 5 or 10 would remove the need to remove memory and time limitations as the transactions involving the addresses are quite big.

Yes, I have noted that long address list on blockchain official site. But your suggestion to lowering the limit is a good suggestion and I will try with that.

Thank you.
The site is running on GoDaddy. If I change to another hosting or upgrade to higher level, will this resolve the issue permanently ?
It should resolve it, shared hosting providers usually lower the limits on memory use and runtime for PHP scripts.
Okay. Thank you.

Hi, 
I have encountered the same problem. After contacting the support and a few tests I think I have found the cause for this. Regarding the instructions you should set your service url like "http://localhost:3000", but you need to enter a slash at the end like "http://localhost:3000/". The Library connects to "http://localhost:3000merchant/..." instead of "http://localhost:3000/merchant/...". This is a silly solution so I changed the setServiceUrl function to add a slash if missing. I also added a pull request for this. Maybe this will help you.

 #42 

kind regards,
Montymort
@Montymort, hey, thanks for answering that issue! If I deal with this api again I'll use your hint. Regards!

The value represents the total btc mined in the last 24 hours.

Hey @denis-dima ,

Sorry about that. Can you explain why this didn't work, and what your solution was? The idea is to run this alongside service-my-wallet-v3 running locally, in which case the code above should work.
Yes - that is the correct solution. Thanks! Would you like to submit a PR with that change?
Yes, I would like to submit the PR.

Thanks, however I have had another look this morning, and it seems that the solution should be leaving `Blockchain.php` as it is, but changing the following line in `Create.php`:

`return new WalletResponse($this->blockchain->post('api/v2/create_wallet', $params));`

to:

`return new WalletResponse($this->blockchain->post('api/v2/create', $params));`

Can you please confirm whether this works for you, and update the PR?
Ok, I will check that and update PR.
Yes, it's working. I will submit updated PR.
Merged. Thank you once again for your help.
Thank you very much for accepting my PR as this is my first PR :)
Congrats!
